title: How to stop Firefox from closing while downloading?
content: When I'm downloading game updates or other files over maybe 300Mb and minimalise Firefox while reading or working on other files, Firefly shuts down and so losing the downloads. How do I stop this from happening?
creator: freewwind6

title: Pocket page keeps reloading after logging in
content:
Hi, I'd like to get back to using the Pocket service, but I'm having such a problem that when I log in using my Firefox account, the Pocket page reloads itself before it even has time to display anything on it. And it is non-stop like this. I've run Firefox in safe mode to disable add-ons, but there is an identical suituation.

Do you know how to deal with this or how to do a troubleshoot of this problem?
creator: firefox.3jg39

title: Installing Firefox 32bit 102.11.0esr on mac

title: Lost my (firefox) home :/
content: So a while back (maybe a year already idk) there was once an update and ever since then i had a pinned tab (a tab that only is an icon?) in the upper left corner that was a sort of a home page of fire fox. Not the usual home page but a place that had like history and stuff. I lost it accidentally and would like to get it back. Does anyone know how?

title: prompt forced in on 114.0.1 advertising firefox product
content: DIRECTLY after 114.0.1 update, I get a CONSTANT UNENDING PROMPT telling me all about firefox , ON EACH AND EVERY SEARCH, I am here to find out how to remove this intentionally annoying, "thing" from MY PC(of course Mozilla couldn't be bothered to tell us they were installing a continuous advertisement for google, and FORCE installing it as search engine). I want this endless advertisement removed, post haste.
creator: henryjames6

title: Downloads>Save File to always on...
content:
Hello Mozilla Support Team,

Since one of the last updates firefox Download Setting seems not work properly...

Into Settings > Files and Applications > Downlods > Save files to option is ALWAYS on, even when "Aways ask you where to save files" option box is checked. When I open a PDF in view mode with Firefox, it automatically download it to the location described into "Save Files to"..in my case Desktop. It seems that the "Save Files to" option doesn't gray out when "Always ask..." option box is checked.

Do you have any idea why I can't chose just one of the two options?

Thanks for you help...

Alex

P.S. Attached screenshot...
creator: zion1995

title: Firefox en Windows
content: Buenos días. Ayer instalé Firefoxen Windows 10, importé mis favoritos y mis contraseñas. Después instale Firefox Developer Edition también en Windows 10 y Firefox para Android en mi teléfono. El problema es que sólo se sincronizan los marcadores (favoritos) pero las contraseñas no se sincronizan en ninguno de los otros dos, ni en el Developer Edition ni en el de Android.
creator: fjavierp

title: Your browser is being managed by your organization
content: Under General Settings at the very top it states "Your browser is being managed by your organization"? Now I have tried to get rid of this by using Regedit and deleting Mozilla under KEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies! Now after restarting Firefox its gone but it comes back once I reboot my computer which is Windows 10 Pro 64 bit Enterprise Edition. Can someone please help me get rid of this for good please? Note: I'm also using Avast Premier Security which may also be invoked? Thank you for reading.
creator: hemi426

title: Automatic dynamic theme to show name of profile in browser header
content:
I use multiple Firefox profiles. I would like an EASY way to see the name of the Firefox profile somewhere on the screen. The attached image shows a theme I created which shows the name of the profile on the menu bar. I forgot exactly how I did it, but it involved typing this in a Word document, taking a screenshot and turning it into a jpeg, crop the image, upload it as a theme, then test it. Repeated several times until I got it to work.

I don't need or want fancy graphics here. I just need the name of the Firefox profile to appear somewhere in the window. In my fantasy world, there would be an option to include this name in the window Title bar.
creator: dan400man1

title: I'm reading an email from Wired Magazine.  Every so often, instead of the photo Wired wants to show me, i get this message: "To honor your privacy preferences, this content can only be viewed on the site it originates from."
content: Please tell me what privacy preference this message refers to, and what I can do to get rid of it. Can I enter "Wired magazine" into some list somewhere of people that send me email who I believe are not sending me poisoned links, or should I simply use Chrome, or Bing, or whatever to read my email? Alternatively, could you please change your message or otherwise tell me what privacy setting I need to change?
creator: jeffmaso

bueno si alguien me ayuda con el problemita hace un mes mas o menos firefox de linux yo iba al apartado de imagees terminaba de cargar y decia cirre inesperado apretaba reestablecer y saltaba lo mismo de cierre inesperado Ahhhh. La pestaña falló. ¡Podemos ayudar!

title: Install custom root CA. Firefox for Linux
content:
Hello. This is a very similar question to https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1408631

I have a significant number of Linux workstations (mix of Fedora 37, Redhat 6.10 extended support, Redhat 7) each with Firefox installed. Most of the Firefox versions are 78.5 with a few 60.3, 68.12, 78.4.

I need to distribute a custom root CA cert to the Firefox cert store. I can't find a good answer to how to do this. A pointer to the steps would be really appreciated.

This will need to be automated (puppet, ansible, salt or similar). Do I just copy the cert to some central location on each workstation and that effectively makes it consulted by every user account's Firefox on that machine? Or do I need to copy to a file specific to each user? Or both?

Many thanks

Will.
creator: ocarina-anchovy-04

title: video file unsupported
content: I was trying to watch a video but it says "no video with supported format and MIME type Found" But I had just watched a video there 10 mins before. Is there a extention for extra file/format types or a way to fix it?
